channel.title: Duke Nukem Forever
channel.description:
[url='https://www.videogameszone.de/aid,702034/Duke-Nukem-Forever-Am-Erfolg-und-am-Geld-gescheitert-Youtube-Video-mit-Gameplayszenen/News/']Some more gameplay video was leaked.[/url]
I find it hard to believe they actually still work on this thing.

item.title: Duke Nukem Forever
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
Yes, it is possible, but slim.

Look, I’m not holding my breath for this game to come out. There are too many other great games coming out that deserve much more attention.

But… when the day comes that Duke Nukem Forever is finally released, the wait for the game will mean absolutely nothing to me. All I want is one last “kick ass and chew bubble gum” romp as gaming’s ultimate ass kicker.

[COLOR=‘Black’]Oh, and did I mention that I was all out of gum? Because that’s kind of important.

Read full topic

Bladex1200:

Comparing them to games now is like comparing a shotgun to a sniper rifle. Both have their strong points. Both have their weak points. Both simply work.

item.title: Duke Nukem Forever
item.dc:creator: gordonfreemantshepha
item.description:
Rga_Noris:

I dunno. The “fix” post seemed like a funny joke to me.

Gotta agree on your point though. While I think that Duke could make a comeback, he has to have a bit of a makeover. It’s like Batman. If the Adam West Batman, complete with comic book “POW” and “KER-PING!” video effects whenever Batman punched someone came back today, it would be laughed at. For the time, however, it caused a following. Now, we have Batman Begins and The Dark Knight, two awesome Batman movies that have minimal ties to the Adam West days, yet are still Batman, and still awesome.

Duke should make an awesome come back but he should still have that edge he had back then

Read full topic

item.title: Duke Nukem Forever
item.dc:creator: Rga_Noris
item.description:
Soviet:

Yeah, I can tell. Because there was a lot of rationality in completely turning around the meaning without an explanation. I suppose it was my mistake, I was under the assumption that somebody might reply back with a semblance of intelligence or thought that would help me understand why so many people continue to support a dead game made by terrible developers that would having nothing to offer in today’s age of games. Obviously, I was mistaken.

I dunno. The “fix” post seemed like a funny joke to me.

Gotta agree on your point though. While I think that Duke could make a comeback, he has to have a bit of a makeover. It’s like Batman. If the Adam West Batman, complete with comic book “POW” and “KER-PING!” video effects whenever Batman punched someone came back today, it would be laughed at. For the time, however, it caused a following. Now, we have Batman Begins and The Dark Knight, two awesome Batman movies that have minimal ties to the Adam West days, yet are still Batman, and still awesome.

Read full topic

item.title: Duke Nukem Forever
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
I was originally going to quote you as “complain complain complain bitch bitch bitch” but I wouldn’t want to put words in your mouth, so I took the liberty to take some out instead.

As for debating on the internet, I’ll pass. An argument between two advocates who are shrouded in the anonymity of the web can rarely invalidate any fallacies. Even with the best of contentions people will still advocate their respective beliefs in the presence of overwhelming affirmations. This is the nature of the beast, and until we lower our shield of anonymity our motives will remain delitescent, and our arguments will remain barbaric.

So you will have to excuse my antics. My goals were to not belittle you but instead to pander to the rest of us. I hope you will understand.

Read full topic

item.title: Duke Nukem Forever
item.dc:creator: Bladex1200
item.description:
JohnKiller118:

We don’t need to explain anything to either of you. The fact is, Duke Nukem 3D was/is awesome and we’ll follow this franchise to hell and i[/i] back!

Amen to that! Stop trying to explain why these shooters suck. They were made in the 1990s. Comparing them to games now is like comparing a shotgun to a sniper rifle. Both have their strong points. Both have their weak points. Both simply work.

Duke Nukem may suck in your eyes, but this series has been through a lot of criticism and I think Duke Nukem Forever will be an awesome addition to the series. Now stop trolling and stop complaining.

/thread

Read full topic

item.title: Duke Nukem Forever
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
They wouldn’t be remaking the same story lacking game. They would obviously make an at least half decent storyline in a new game. Although I haven’t played any Duke Nukem games that one is a no brainier. How many games do you see today that recycle the same exact story line or game play as the last game. Aside from the pointless argument of if Duke Nukem is a good game or not (which no one will win because fans will be fans and haters will be haters), does anyone know a good place to start playing Duke Nukem? Should I start with 3D or like which is the one people like most or has the awesome phrase’s such as kickin’ ass and chew bubble gum?

Read full topic
